results.title: Water drops on burning rocks = Gouttes d'eau sur pierres brulantes
results.creator_credit: Francois Ozon, Alain Sarde, Marc Missonnier, Olivier Delbosc, Eurospace, Les Films Alain Sarde and Fidelite Productions
results.brief_description: Based on Rainer Werner Fassbinder’s play “Tropfen auf hiesse Steine” this richly perverse and very funny sex comedy stars Bernard Giraudeau as Leopold, an ultra successful and ultra conservative businessman who seduces the young Franz. But when Franz moves in, all expectations are overturned when it is Leopold who refuses to compromise to Franz’s old fashioned sense of morality and domesticity. Franz turns to his ex-girlfriend for comfort but she too ends up falling for Leopold’s cold seductive charms. Their bizarre menage-a-trois is then interrupted when Leopold’s ex, Vera, a male to female transsexual, comes for a visit. Rather than needlessly “opening up” the original play’s stagebound scenes, Ozon instead creates a slightly surreal enclosed space in which the four actors are able to create characters both bizarre but also strikingly realistic. The crisp, imaginative direction allows for both the humour of the original play, as well as its cruelty, to be fully expressed. A wonderfully fresh and stylish comedy of manners, “Water Drops on Burning Rocks” is a splendid example of how queer cinema can transgress both heterosexual and homosexual normative ideals. Cast includes Malik Zidi, Ludivine Sagnier and Anna Levine. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Water country, south of the Changjiang River
results.creator_credit: Central Newsreel and Documentary Film Studio of the People's Republic of China
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8301 of Series “China Today”
A look at the lifestyle, agriculture and industries of the Changjiang River region, Southern China.

results.title: Water conservation
results.creator_credit: Simon Campbell-Jones, David Cobham, Film Producers Guild, David Cobham Productions and Guild House Films
results.brief_description: Explains the advantages to the farmer of having his own water conservation scheme. Shows how a small reservoir can be constructed to make water available for irrigation purposes during the summer. Hints are given on siting, selection of water source and use of plastic or waterproof linings.

results.title: Water birds of the inland
results.creator_credit: Norman Castle, Lilias Castle, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Shows general feeding and nesting habits of a variety of inland water birds at Narran Lake, Western NSW (also known as Terewah Lake) and its surrounding marshy area.

results.title: Water Babies
results.brief_description: Shows how to teach young children to control their breathing in water, how to teach them to float, kick their feet and use their arms, and then further develop their water skills. Children who have been properly and safely made aware of water are given the confidence everyone needs when learning to swim.

results.title: Water and romi = Air dan romi
results.creator_credit: Garin Nugroho and S E T Film Workshop
results.brief_description: This documentary was produced for the International Seminar on Water, held in Jakarta in December 1991 under the auspices of the Goethe Institute, Indonesia. Water mongers and river cleaners, amongst others, are interviewed in this look at life along the rivers and the worrying condition of water supply in the bustling city of Jakarta. The film was banned by Suharto’s New Order Government. In Bahasa Indonesia with English subtitles.

results.title: Water against wildfire
results.creator_credit: David Morgan, John Richardson, Victorian Film Corporation and Kestrel Films (Australia)
results.brief_description: This film was made at the request of Victoria’s Forest Commission. Bush fires all over Australia and indeed all parts of the world create havoc not only on the environment of humans but also on the delicate balance of the natural world. A training film directed towards forest workers on how to use water on forest fires and the follow-up after the fire has been contained.

results.title: Water-polo teamwork
results.brief_description: Waterpolo is an exciting and skilful game to play and watch, particularly when players adopt an attacking approach. The basic offensive move in waterloo is to make a “break” on your opponent ie. to be a body length or more in front of him/her while swimming towards the goal. Various configurations are shown in this program, from simple one on one break, to complex manoeuvres. Demonstrations by 1984 Australian Waterpolo Squad.

results.title: Water-Polo Skills
results.brief_description: In the context of a game of water polo between two school boy teams, we see the fundamental skills to be mastered, including those of a goalkeeper. The skills are the water polo kick, swimming with the ball, and ways to pick the ball up, catching and passing, the roll, the tackle and pass, and five different shots for goal.

results.title: Water
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Problems of conservation”
Shows innovative ways to increase water supplies - percolation ponds, desalination of salt water, artificial weather control. Indicates that pollution control is equally important in conserving and purifying present water supplies.
Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
